remark.p: Foreign Service Officer. Career Ambassador; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic, Energy, and Business Affairs; Representative of the U.S.A. to the European Union, with the rank and status of Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary; Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary (Panama); Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary (Pakistan); Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary (El Salvador); Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary (Costa Rica); Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary (Congo (Kinshasa)).
Director, Office of Atlantic Political-Economic Affairs, Bureau of European Affairs, Department of State, until August 1967
Assistant Director, Council on International Economic Policy, 1971-1973; thereafter Deputy Director
Assistant Director, Council on International Economic Policy from March 1971
Assistant Director of the Council on International Economic Policy

Deputy Executive Director of the Council on International Economic Policy; Ambassador to Zaire from August 21, 1974 until June 18, 1975 (declared persona non grata); temporarily assigned to the Office of the Under Secretary of State for Economic Affairs; Representative to the European Communities from January 29, 1976
U.S. Ambassador to Zaire from June 20, 1974, until June 18, 1975; U.S. Representative to the European Communities from January 1976

Assistant Director, Council on International Economic Policy until 1973; Deputy Director, Council on International Economic Policy from 1973 until 1974; Ambassador to the Democratic Republic of the Congo from June 1974 until June 1975; Representative to the European Communities from January 1976
Assistant Director, Council on International Economic Policy from 1971 until 1973
U.S. Representative to the European Community from January 29, 1976 until December 3, 1979; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from January 4, 1980

Assistant Director, White House Council on International Economic Policy, from 1973 until 1974; Deputy Director, White House Council on International Economic Policy, from 1974; U.S. Ambassador to Zaire (Democratic Republic of the Congo) from August 21, 1974, until June 18, 1975; U.S. Representative to the European Communities from January 29, 1976
Deputy Director, Council on International Economic Policy, Executive Office of the President
Representative to the European Communities from January 29, 1976 to December 3, 1979
Representative to the European Communities until December 1979; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from January 1980
Representative to the European Communities until December 3, 1979; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from January 4, 1980
